Worker Module¶

Worker Module¶

class Worker.Worker(id)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

The worker is a thread, which puts tasks into a queue and then processes these tasks each.

It has to provide certain statistics in order for the load balancing methods to work.

__init__(id)[source]¶
Parameters:id – the unique identifier this worker is initialized with
curr_number = 1¶
desired_number = 0¶
disable()[source]¶

disables this worker :return: None

do_task(number)[source]¶

This function gets called by the load balancer methods, it increments the tasks_received member and puts the task into the internal queue :param number: :return: None

enable()[source]¶

enables this worker :return: None

get_disabled()[source]¶
Returns:whether this worker is disabled or enabled as a boolean
get_id()[source]¶
Returns:the unique identifier as an int
get_load()[source]¶

The Agent Based Adaptive Balancing algorithm needs the worker to provice a numeric valuei in the range of 0 and 102. In this case, 0 = idle, 99 = overload, 101 = server down/administratively disabled :return: the amount of stress this worker is under or a status code

get_result()[source]¶
Returns:the curr_number as an int
get_tasks_finished()[source]¶
Returns:the amount of tasks finished
get_tasks_received()[source]¶
Returns:the amount of tasks received (=> the amount of tasks put into the queue) as an int
get_tasks_remaining()[source]¶
Returns:the amount of tasks remaining to be processed
get_time_last_task()[source]¶
Returns:the amount of time the last task took to process as a float
is_disabled = False¶
progress = 0¶
run()[source]¶

The run function is a while True loop :return: None

tasks_finished = 0¶
tasks_received = 0¶
time_last_task = 0¶
